intro: Cupania pallidula, commonly known as the palecupania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually elliptic or ovate in shape. Cupania pallidula is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in shaded to semi-shaded conditions.
